dict.string: Days To Go displays photos from your library that were taken on reflection dates, helping you remember what you were doing when creating countdowns to future events. Photos are only accessed when viewing reminders and are never uploaded or shared.

Days To Go shows calendar events from reflection dates to provide context about what was happening in your life when counting down to important events. Calendar data is only read locally and never modified or shared.
Days To Go displays your location history on reflection dates, showing where you were when counting down to events. Location data is stored locally and synced privately via iCloud.

Days To Go builds a location history in the background so you can see where you were on reflection dates when viewing reminders. Location data is stored locally for 90 days, synced privately via your iCloud account, and never shared with third parties. You can disable location tracking in Settings at any time.
